result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory W. Simplot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 15CF43.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  No contact with any known drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Comply with any treatment or counseling recommended by his agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: same as prison sentence.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gregory W. Simplot
Current: W10698 W 7th St., Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2017)
Prior: 339 1/2 Chestnut St, Blk River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Parties have received the PSI.  Inlow noted one typo.  Attorney Sebion believes defendant should be eligible for SAR.  15CF43.   State recommends 7 years total.  30 months initial confinement, 4 1/2 years extended supervision.  14CF233 - 2 years total, 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision. Concurrent.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  No contact with known drug users or dealers.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Attorney Sebion spoke.  Requesting probation with some jail time.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  15CF43 -  7 1/2  years total.  3 1/2 years  initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision.   14CF233 - Count 1 - 3 years total.  1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Count 2-  4 years total.   2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.   Concurrent.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  No contact with known drug users.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Comply with any treatment or counseling recommended by the agent.   CC.  Not eligible for CIP.  Eligible for SAP.  Credit for 15 days in 15CF43.  Attorney Sebion requesting time to report.  Not allowed.  Remand into custody.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared late.   Attorney Sebion appeared.  Defendant has contacted a private attorney.  Asking for 30 days.  Attorney Sebion not filing a motion to withdraw at this time.  Court questioned defendant on why he didn't appear this morning.  Alarm didn't go off right.  State requesting cash bond and not wanting to postpone sentencing for 30 days.  Warrant quashed.  Cash bond not ordered.  Court gave defendant a warning if he failed to appear on time again a cash bond will be ordered.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Defendant FTA for sentencing hearing.  Defendant called SPD last week requesting a new attorney, but he was told he had to appear today.  Warrant authorized.
e-mailed copy of PSI to Judge.  Paper copies to ADA & Attorney Sebion.
Defendant's Waiver of Information filed within Statutory Time Limits.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Defense filed a waiver with the court regarding the failure of the State to file information in a timely manner.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the issue.  Defendant stated he understood and still wishes to proceed.  Court found that the defendant made the waiver knowingly and voluntarily.  Defendant plead no contest to Counts 1 and 2  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Court gave felony warnings to defendant.  He understands.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the pleas.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and entered his pleas.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Counts 1 and 2.   Counts  3-7 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  PSI ordered.  Due 12/4/15.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody and with Attorney Sebion.  Information not filed.  Attorney Sebion needs to talk to her client regarding that fact.  Plea adjourned to 10/16/15 at 3:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Set for plea hearing.  10/12/15 at 1:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared late with Attorney Sebion.  Authorized warrant quashed.  STC set for 9/21/15 at 3 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State. Defendant FTA for STC.  Attorney Sebion appeared.  If defendant doesn't appear by Monday, 9/21.  JT will be removed, per Court.

Final pre-trial at 09-14-2015 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person at 10-08-2015 09:00 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  No resolution.  Set 14CF233 for 2 day JT calendar.  STC the other cases same date and time.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  An offer has been made, but no agreement yet.  STC set for 6/8/15 at 3 pm

Cheryl Sisco court reporter.  ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Sebion.  Court reviewed waiver of preliminary hearing with defendant.  Defendant understood waiver.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to preliminary hearing.
ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant did not appear.  Attorney Sebion appeared.  Requests case be set for waiver of preliminary hearing, plea/sentencing.  3/2/15 at 10:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on January 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Reading of complaint waived.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Must comply with all probation conditions on separate case.
Defendant appeared by video from JCJ with no attorney present.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Bond set with return date.

Adjourned initial appearance on December 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.
